TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WSTrustServiceContract extends System.Object implements class System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehavior, class System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension, class System.ServiceModel.Security.IWSTrust13AsyncContract, class System.ServiceModel.Security.IWSTrust13SyncContract, class System.ServiceModel.Security.IWSTrustFeb2005AsyncContract, class System.ServiceModel.Security.IWSTrustFeb2005SyncContract

Docs.summary: Definition of the WS-Trust service contract implementation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Implements the following service contract interfaces:
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.IWSTrustFeb2005SyncContract>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.IWSTrust13SyncContract>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.IWSTrustFeb2005AsyncContract>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.IWSTrust13AsyncContract>

Docs.param: The that exports the contract information.
Provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the contract description.
Docs.summary: When implemented in a derived class, writes custom Web Services Description Language (WSDL) elements into the generated WSDL for a contract.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Provides an implementation of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportContract%2A> method. The default implementation does nothing. You can override this method in a derived class to implement specific behavior.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ExportEndpoint (System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter exporter, System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlEndpointConversionContext context);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ExportEndpoint(class System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter exporter, class System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlEndpointConversionContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The that exports the contract information.
Provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the endpoint description.
Docs.summary: Writes custom Web Services Description Language (WSDL) elements into the generated WSDL for an endpoint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportEndpoint%2A> method.
The default implementation does the following for every WS-Trust contract found:
1. Includes the appropriate WS-Trust namespace in the WSDL.
2. Imports the appropriate WS-Trust schema and all dependent schemas.
3. Fixes the Messages of each operation to appropriate WS-Trust equivalents. The WS-Trust Contract exposed by Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) takes a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> in and returns a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> out. But WS-Trust messages expect an RST and return an RSTR/RSTRC. This method fixes the message names with the appropriate WS-Trust messages.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void FixMessageElement (System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription serviceDescription, System.Web.Services.Description.PortType portType, System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlEndpointConversionContext context, string operationName, System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName inputMessageElement, System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName outputMessageElement);

.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void FixMessageElement(class System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription serviceDescription, class System.Web.Services.Description.PortType portType, class System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlEndpointConversionContext context, string operationName, class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName inputMessageElement, class System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName outputMessageElement) cil managed

Docs.param: The that has the current state of the exported WSDL.
The WSDL PortType for which the messages are to be fixed.
Provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the endpoint description.
The operation name inside the PortType.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> of the input message element.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> of the output message element.
Docs.summary: During WSDL generation, this method fixes a specified operation message element to refer to the RST and RSTR elements of the appropriate WS-Trust version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The WS-Trust Contract exposed by Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) takes a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> in and returns a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> out. But WS-Trust messages expect an RST and return an RSTR/RSTRC. This method fixes the message names with the appropriate WS-Trust messages specified by the XML qualified names in `inputMessageElement` and `outputMessageLement`.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void ValidateDispatchContext (System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext dispatchContext);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void ValidateDispatchContext(class System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext dispatchContext) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to validate.
Docs.summary: Validates the specified object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method ensures that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.DispatchContext> Object represents a legal request prior to being passed into the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustServiceContract.DispatchRequest%2A> method. The default implementation rejects incoming RST messages with RSTR actions and vice versa.
